sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere with radius 4 cm?
message_2:
The volume V of a sphere is given by the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere. In this case, the radius is 4 cm. Plugging this value into the formula, we get:

V = (4/3)π(4³)

V = (4/3)π(64)

V = 256/3π

The volume of the sphere with radius 4 cm is approximately 268.08 cubic centimeters.
